subject: Ethics
title: Somalia Intervention Lessons
description: A quick win: understand Somalia Intervention Lessons.

hook.text: In 1993, U.S. soldiers went to Somalia to feed the starving. Eighteen came home in coffins.

buildup.text: The humanitarian mission escalated into urban warfare in Mogadishuâ€”the 'Black Hawk Down' disaster.

discovery.text: The lesson: good intentions don't guarantee good outcomes. Intervention without planning creates chaos.

twist.text: After Somalia, the U.S. refused to intervene in Rwanda. The fear of another failure cost 800,000 lives.

climax.text: Somalia proved that doing something can go wrong. Rwanda proved that doing nothing can be worse.

punchline.text: Failed intervention or none at allâ€”both carry a body count.

quiz.question: How did the Somalia intervention affect the U.S. response to the Rwandan genocide?
options: The fear of repeating Somalia's failure led the U.S. to refuse to intervene in Rwanda
It led the U.S. to deploy a larger, better-equipped force to Rwanda
It had no impactâ€”the U.S. intervened in Rwanda immediately
